titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Dianne Post Papers LSC.2228
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Stacy Wood, 2014; updated by Sabrina Ponce, 2018; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.date: Online finding aid last updated 02 March 2018.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-03-02T15:28-0800

did.abstract: Dianne Post is a lawyer who specializes in developing policy and programmatic reform on issues related to gender equality. Also active in the lesbian feminist movement, she organized cultural and political activities in Arizona to challenge domestic violence and advocate for the rights of the LGBT community. This collection contains organizational documents from activist organizations throughout Arizona specifically focused on domestic violence and gay and lesbian issues. Included are materials related to the planning of the first women's music festival in Arizona as well as recordings of lesbian and women's music. Also included are legal documents authored by or used by Dianne Post, articles published by and about Dianne Post, correspondence, and ephemera.
did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Dianne Post papers (Collection 2228). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Provenance/Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, transfer, 2014. Original provenance unknown.
This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: Processed by Stacy Wood, February 2014. Description enhanced and further physical processing completed by Sabrina Ponce in 2018.

odd.head: Sponsor
odd.p: The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Dianne Post (born 1947) is a lawyer who has worked in over fourteen countries over the past twenty six years. She has contributed to the design and implementation of legal policies and reform initiatives related to gender equality. Post works with vulnerable populations in developing, transitional and developed countries.

Post consults on international cases, and has worked with the United Nations, the Inter-American Commission on Human Rights and the European Court of Human Rights. She specializes in issues related to violence against women and children including sex-trafficking, pornography, and domestic violence.
Also active in the lesbian feminist movement, she was the first to produce a women's music festival in Arizona, the Arizona Womyn's Music Festival.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains organizational documents from activist organizations throughout Arizona specifically focused on domestic violence and gay and lesbian issues. Included are materials related to the planning of Arizona Womyn's Music Festival (the first women's music festival in Arizona) as well as recordings of lesbian and women's music. Also included are legal documents authored by or used by Dianne Post, articles published by and about Dianne Post, correspondence, and ephemera.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS AUDIO MATERIALS: Audio materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

COLLECTION CONTAINS DIGITAL MATERIALS: Special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

controlaccess.corpname: June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA.
controlaccess.subject: Human rights workers--United States--Archives.
Lesbian activists--United States--Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Assorted feminist publications, including the last issue of Off Our Backs and Lavender Moon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Fundraising materials, clippings and interview on one cassette tape with lesbian presidential candidate Sonia Johnson.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS AUDIO MATERIALS: Audio materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Flyers, maps, programs and festival information, which Post helped organize.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Copies of clippings and publications regarding domestic violence.

did.unittitle: Clippings of articles by Dianne Post

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Articles and op-eds written or contributed to by Dianne Post in various magazines and newspapers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Flyers for events, readings and talks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Newsletters for organizations including Valley Community Women, Women's Center Inc. and Arizona Women's News.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Clippings of newspaper and magazine stories concerning the activism and professional life of Dianne Post.

did.unittitle: Valley of the Sun Gay and Lesbian Community Center

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Board meeting minutes, communication, reports, programming discussions for the Valley of the Sun Gay and Lesbian Community Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Financial documents, articles of incorporation, press releases, promotional ephemera, and other documents related to the formation and work of Arizonans for Fairness Coalition, Inc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Newsletter and flyer from the Lesbian Resource Project, an Arizona lesbian social and educational group. Also includes a certificate of appreciation for Post.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Publications having to do with legal news, philosophies and discussions.

did.unittitle: Legal documents: New Times Inc. v. Women Take Back the Night

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Depositions, briefs, summaries and communication surrounding this case. Women Take Back the Night, of which Post was a member, was an organization dedicated to protesting against domestic violence.

did.unittitle: Legal documents: Lesbian couple child custody cases

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Briefs, summaries, trial documents and depositions having to do with several child custody cases between lesbian couples.

did.unittitle: State Bar of Arizona : Gay and Lesbian Task Force Report

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Bound copy of the State Bar of Arizona's report by the Gay and Lesbian Task Force.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, news clippings and notes having to do with Dianne Post's (and others') activism and protest concerning the appointment of anti-choice Board Members to both Planned Parenthood and the Arizona Human Rights Fund.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Business cards and personal items.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes three t-shirts from the Arizona Womyn's Music Festival, 6 CDs and 29 audiocassettes containing recordings by lesbian musicians, several buttons and pins, and a number of published books:

Elaine Mikels - Just Lucky I guess Ruthann Robson - Lesbian (Out)Law Daphne Scholinski - The Last Time I Wore a Dress Karen Louise - Foster Child Karen Dale Wolman - Rites of First Blood Susan Hawthorne - Wild Politics Marilyn Murphy - Are You Girls Traveling Alone? Joann Drury - The Other Side of Silence Becky Birtha - Lover's Choice Jennifer Kelly - Zest for Life Olivia Free Woman - The Incident at New Providence Olivia Free Woman - Selected Works The Practical Lawyer - Vol. 33, 37
